_metadata.context: Integrated Framework for Inquiry and Creation

concepts.name: Abduction
concepts.theory_application: Use abductive reasoning to infer the most plausible explanation for a surprising set of observations, prioritizing explanatory power and simplicity.

variations.theory: Definition: Koestler defined creativity as 'bisociation'—combining two unrelated matrices of thought. Procedural Link: The generated hypothesis is the simplest and most likely explanation that would explain the facts, prioritizing explanatory elegance.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Diagnostic Hypothesis based on symptoms.

variations.theory: Definition: Christensen defines disruptive innovation. Procedural Link: The generated hypothesis successfully infers the hidden, non-obvious 'Job-to-be-Done' that the current product is failing to satisfy.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Hidden Need Hypothesis for the patient.

variations.theory: Definition: Deconstruction reveals the limits of the language. Procedural Link: The generated hypothesis is the single interpretation that explains the most textual evidence (treating the text as a crime scene).
variations.specific_deliverable: A Textual Inference from medical history.

variations.theory: Definition: Duchamp re-contextualized ordinary objects as art. Procedural Link: The generated idea successfully infers the underlying aesthetic rule that must have been broken to create the successful deviation ('happy accident').
variations.specific_deliverable: A Creative Accident Log of symptoms.

variations.theory: Definition: Ostrom studied self-governing institutions. Procedural Link: The generated solution addresses the relational breakdown that must have occurred to cause the conflict, prioritizing relational causes over individual blame.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Relational Inference of stress factors.

variations.theory: Definition: Facilitating the learning and transfer of Abduction. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Use abductive reasoning to infer the most plausible explanation for a surprising set of observations, prioritizing explanatory power and simplicity.

Definition: The universal structural principle of Abduction. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Use abductive reasoning to infer the most plausible explanation for a surprising set of observations, prioritizing explanatory power and simplicity.

concepts.name: Analogy
concepts.scenario: Designing a more efficient wind turbine.
concepts.theory_application: Identify a structural similarity between the current problem and a solved problem in a different domain, transferring the solution's core principle.

variations.theory: Definition: Koestler defined creativity as 'bisociation'—combining two unrelated matrices of thought. Procedural Link: The generated solution successfully abstracts the problem to its deepest structural level and finds a comparable solution in an unrelated scientific or engineering field.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Biomimetic Design based on whale fins.

variations.theory: Definition: Christensen defines disruptive innovation. Procedural Link: The generated idea applies a successful business model pattern (e.g., 'razor and blades') from one industry to a completely different market.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Business Model Analogy ('Uber for Wind').

variations.theory: Definition: Deconstruction reveals the limits of the language. Procedural Link: The generated analogy (e.g., the panopticon) successfully illuminates the power dynamics of a contemporary social system.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Historical Parallel to the steam engine.

variations.theory: Definition: Duchamp re-contextualized ordinary objects as art. Procedural Link: The generated idea successfully uses a principle from one medium (e.g., musical counterpoint) to organize the elements of another (e.g., visual composition).
variations.specific_deliverable: A Visual Metaphor of a spinning flower.

variations.theory: Definition: Ostrom studied self-governing institutions. Procedural Link: The generated solution successfully uses a mythic analogy to frame a current social challenge, finding solutions in established integrated knowledge traditions.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Mythic Analogy to the wind god.

variations.theory: Definition: Facilitating the learning and transfer of Analogy. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Identify a structural similarity between the current problem and a solved problem in a different domain, transferring the solution's core principle.

Definition: The universal structural principle of Analogy. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Identify a structural similarity between the current problem and a solved problem in a different domain, transferring the solution's core principle.

concepts.name: Bodystorming
concepts.scenario: Designing a cockpit for a new plane.
concepts.theory_application: Physically enact the user experience or system behavior using the body and props to discover constraints and opportunities that are invisible in abstract thought.

variations.theory: Definition: Koestler defined creativity as 'bisociation'—combining two unrelated matrices of thought. Procedural Link: The physical enactment successfully anticipates physical constraints and ergonomic issues in the lab setup.
variations.specific_deliverable: An Ergonomic Test Log of reach distances.
variations.rubric: Act out experiment to anticipate constraints.

variations.theory: Definition: Christensen defines disruptive innovation. Procedural Link: The role-play generates embodied empathy and reveals a flaw in the user journey that was not visible in the wireframe.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Service Roleplay Video of the pilot.

variations.theory: Definition: Deconstruction reveals the limits of the language. Procedural Link: The enactment successfully generates and tests multiple solutions to a social problem in real-time.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Forum Theatre Script for crew communication.

variations.theory: Definition: Duchamp re-contextualized ordinary objects as art. Procedural Link: The improvisational movement successfully discovers a novel aesthetic gesture or movement pattern.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Choreographic Sketch of control movements.

variations.theory: Definition: Ostrom studied self-governing institutions. Procedural Link: The ceremonial movement successfully explores relational dynamics and achieves a state of collective harmony.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Physical Arrangement Map of the cockpit.

variations.theory: Definition: Facilitating the learning and transfer of Bodystorming. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Physically enact the user experience or system behavior using the body and props to discover constraints and opportunities that are invisible in abstract thought.

Definition: The universal structural principle of Bodystorming. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Physically enact the user experience or system behavior using the body and props to discover constraints and opportunities that are invisible in abstract thought.

concepts.name: Brainstorming
concepts.theory_application: Generate a large quantity of ideas by suspending judgment and building on others' contributions, prioritizing volume over quality in the initial phase.

variations.theory: Definition: Osborn defined the rule of 'defer judgment'. Procedural Link: The action is to prioritize the quantity of ideas generated over the initial quality to maximize the chance of a breakthrough.

Definition: Design Thinking uses time-boxing to force divergence. Procedural Link: The action is to use time-boxing and a high quota (e.g., 50 ideas in 15 minutes) to force the team into a divergent, System 1 mindset.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Post-it Wall Capture of team ideas.

variations.theory: Definition: PAR requires the research question to emerge from the community. Procedural Link: The action is to generate ideas through collective dialogue with the community, ensuring the solutions are grounded in lived experience.
variations.specific_deliverable: An Alternative Warrants List for the brand.

variations.theory: Definition: SCAMPER is a checklist for systematic variation. Procedural Link: The action is to use structured constraints (SCAMPER) to systematically generate variations on an existing concept.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Variation Matrix of name concepts.

variations.theory: Definition: The Circle Way uses a 'go-round' protocol to ensure equitable participation. Procedural Link: The action is to generate ideas through a 'go-round' protocol, ensuring every voice contributes an idea before any discussion or critique begins.
variations.specific_deliverable: An Intervention List for brand impact.

variations.theory: Definition: Facilitating the learning and transfer of Brainstorming. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Generate a large quantity of ideas by suspending judgment and building on others' contributions, prioritizing volume over quality in the initial phase.

Definition: The universal structural principle of Brainstorming. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Generate a large quantity of ideas by suspending judgment and building on others' contributions, prioritizing volume over quality in the initial phase.

concepts.name: Co-Creation
concepts.theory_application: Involve the end-users or stakeholders directly in the design process, sharing power and decision-making to ensure the outcome is relevant and owned by the community.

variations.theory: Definition: Koestler defined creativity as 'bisociation'—combining two unrelated matrices of thought. Procedural Link: The final experimental design includes non-scientists (e.g., policy makers, community members) in the design process.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Citizen Science Protocol for biodiversity.

variations.theory: Definition: Christensen defines disruptive innovation. Procedural Link: The final user stories and acceptance criteria are collaboratively generated by the Product Owner and the Development Team.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Joint Backlog of park features.

variations.theory: Definition: Deconstruction reveals the limits of the language. Procedural Link: The research questions and methodology are co-designed with the community being studied, ensuring they have control over the process.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Co-Design Workshop Report with residents.

variations.theory: Definition: Duchamp re-contextualized ordinary objects as art. Procedural Link: The final work incorporates feedback from the audience or community in the final stages of creation.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Community Mural Plan painted by locals.

variations.theory: Definition: Ostrom studied self-governing institutions. Procedural Link: The final decision includes future generations (through simulation or proxy) in the decision-making process.
variations.specific_deliverable: An Intergenerational Council Log of wishes.

variations.theory: Definition: Facilitating the learning and transfer of Co-Creation. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Involve the end-users or stakeholders directly in the design process, sharing power and decision-making to ensure the outcome is relevant and owned by the community.

Definition: The universal structural principle of Co-Creation. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Involve the end-users or stakeholders directly in the design process, sharing power and decision-making to ensure the outcome is relevant and owned by the community.

concepts.name: Conception
concepts.scenario: The moment of having a startup idea.
concepts.theory_application: Crystallize the initial, abstract idea into a concrete, communicable form that captures its essential nature and value.

variations.theory: Definition: Koestler defined creativity as 'bisociation'—combining two unrelated matrices of thought. Procedural Link: The conception is complete when the hypothesis is simple enough to be explained to a novice, revealing the depth of the underlying idea.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Napkin Sketch of the core mechanism.

variations.theory: Definition: Christensen defines disruptive innovation. Procedural Link: The conception is complete when the idea is framed as a 'Minimal Viable Product (MVP)'—the smallest thing that can be built to test the riskiest assumption.
variations.specific_deliverable: An MVP Concept for the first test.
variations.rubric: Complete when idea is framed as MVP.

variations.theory: Definition: Deconstruction reveals the limits of the language. Procedural Link: The conception is complete when the scholar has formulated a Claim that is both specific and significant.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Draft Claim for the pitch deck.

variations.theory: Definition: Duchamp re-contextualized ordinary objects as art. Procedural Link: The conception is complete when the artist has found the 'visual tension' that will drive the composition.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Concept Art piece showing the tension.

variations.theory: Definition: Ostrom studied self-governing institutions. Procedural Link: The conception is complete when the 'felt sense' of ethical rightness aligns with the logical analysis of the dilemma.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Gut Check Log confirming alignment.

variations.theory: Definition: Facilitating the learning and transfer of Conception. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Crystallize the initial, abstract idea into a concrete, communicable form that captures its essential nature and value.

Definition: The universal structural principle of Conception. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Crystallize the initial, abstract idea into a concrete, communicable form that captures its essential nature and value.

concepts.name: Creativity
concepts.theory_application: Generate a novel and useful solution by combining existing elements in a new way, often by connecting previously unrelated domains.

variations.theory: Definition: Koestler defined creativity as 'bisociation'—combining two unrelated matrices of thought. Procedural Link: The generated solution successfully combines two previously unrelated matrices of thought (e.g., biology and engineering).
variations.specific_deliverable: A Hybrid Solution mixing biology and traffic.

variations.theory: Definition: Christensen defines disruptive innovation. Procedural Link: The team reports high levels of autonomy and focused time (low distraction) during the ideation phase.
variations.specific_deliverable: An Innovation Lab Report from the team.

variations.theory: Definition: Deconstruction reveals the limits of the language. Procedural Link: The generated interpretation successfully challenges the dominant narrative and generates a new, more just interpretation of history or culture.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Radical Proposal for car-free zones.

variations.theory: Definition: Duchamp re-contextualized ordinary objects as art. Procedural Link: The artist reports entering a 'Flow State' where the challenge perfectly matches their skill, leading to effortless innovation.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Flow State Output of the new map.

variations.theory: Definition: Ostrom studied self-governing institutions. Procedural Link: The generated solution successfully changes the rules of the system to generate a more sustainable and equitable outcome.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Rule Change Proposal for congestion pricing.

variations.theory: Definition: Facilitating the learning and transfer of Creativity. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Generate a novel and useful solution by combining existing elements in a new way, often by connecting previously unrelated domains.

Definition: The universal structural principle of Creativity. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Generate a novel and useful solution by combining existing elements in a new way, often by connecting previously unrelated domains.

concepts.name: Divergence
concepts.theory_application: Expand the solution space by generating a wide variety of ideas, options, or interpretations without immediate judgment or selection.

variations.theory: Definition: Koestler defined creativity as 'bisociation'—combining two unrelated matrices of thought. Procedural Link: The session prioritizes the quantity of hypotheses generated over the initial quality to maximize the chance of a breakthrough.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Hypothesis Portfolio of 50 AI futures.

variations.theory: Definition: Christensen defines disruptive innovation. Procedural Link: The session uses the rule of 'Yes, and...' to build on ideas rather than shutting them down with premature judgment.
variations.specific_deliverable: An Idea Tree branching from core concepts.

variations.theory: Definition: Deconstruction reveals the limits of the language. Procedural Link: The generated interpretations successfully reveal the limits of the language and its inherent contradictions.
variations.specific_deliverable: An Interpretive Range of AI ethics.

variations.theory: Definition: Duchamp re-contextualized ordinary objects as art. Procedural Link: The session generates at least 10 variations on an existing concept using the SCAMPER checklist.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Style Variations sheet for AI interfaces.

variations.theory: Definition: Ostrom studied self-governing institutions. Procedural Link: The generated solutions target high-leverage points in the system (e.g., changing a rule) rather than low-leverage points (e.g., fixing a symptom).
variations.specific_deliverable: A Divergent Voice Log from the council.

variations.theory: Definition: Facilitating the learning and transfer of Divergence. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Expand the solution space by generating a wide variety of ideas, options, or interpretations without immediate judgment or selection.

Definition: The universal structural principle of Divergence. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Expand the solution space by generating a wide variety of ideas, options, or interpretations without immediate judgment or selection.

concepts.name: Emergence
concepts.scenario: Observing a new social media trend.
concepts.theory_application: Observe and identify complex patterns or behaviors that arise spontaneously from the interaction of simple rules or agents, without central control.

variations.expert: Santa Fe Institute - The Complexity Scientist
variations.theory: Definition: Koestler defined creativity as 'bisociation'—combining two unrelated matrices of thought. Procedural Link: The experiment successfully observes unpredictable macro-level patterns that arise from simple, local rules.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Pattern Recognition Log of viral spread.

variations.theory: Definition: Christensen defines disruptive innovation. Procedural Link: The market's reaction to the MVP is an emergent signal that cannot be predicted, only sensed and responded to.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Market Signal Report on user adoption.

variations.theory: Definition: Deconstruction reveals the limits of the language. Procedural Link: The research question successfully emerges from the community dialogue, rather than being imposed by the researcher.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Community Question List generated bottom-up.

variations.theory: Definition: Duchamp re-contextualized ordinary objects as art. Procedural Link: The final form successfully emerges from the artist's responsive dialogue with the material.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Material Dialogue Log of the clay's response.
variations.rubric: Allow form to emerge from dialogue.

variations.theory: Definition: Ostrom studied self-governing institutions. Procedural Link: The wise solution successfully emerges from the collective intelligence of the system.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Collective Integrated Knowledge Summary of the trend.

variations.theory: Definition: Facilitating the learning and transfer of Emergence. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Observe and identify complex patterns or behaviors that arise spontaneously from the interaction of simple rules or agents, without central control.

Definition: The universal structural principle of Emergence. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Observe and identify complex patterns or behaviors that arise spontaneously from the interaction of simple rules or agents, without central control.

concepts.name: Exaptation
concepts.scenario: Finding a new use for old mining tunnels.
concepts.theory_application: Take a feature, tool, or resource that evolved for one specific purpose and adapt it to solve a completely different problem in a new context.

variations.theory: Definition: Koestler defined creativity as 'bisociation'—combining two unrelated matrices of thought. Procedural Link: The generated idea successfully applies a tool or feature that evolved for one purpose (e.g., a lab sensor) and apply it to a completely new, unrelated scientific problem.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Geothermal Energy Plan using the tunnels.

variations.theory: Definition: Christensen defines disruptive innovation. Procedural Link: The generated idea applies an underutilized core capability (e.g., a unique data set) to a new market to create a disruptive product.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Data Center Proposal for secure storage.

variations.theory: Definition: Deconstruction reveals the limits of the language. Procedural Link: The analysis successfully shows how a social technology (e.g., the census) was exapted by the state for a purpose other than its original intent.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Historical Use Analysis of underground spaces.

variations.theory: Definition: Duchamp re-contextualized ordinary objects as art. Procedural Link: The generated idea successfully re-contextualizes an existing object as art, exapting its functional form for aesthetic meaning.
variations.specific_deliverable: An Installation Concept turning tunnels to galleries.

variations.theory: Definition: Ostrom studied self-governing institutions. Procedural Link: The generated solution successfully applies an ancient cultural practice (e.g., a sustainable harvesting method) to solve a modern environmental problem.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Commons Management Plan for the space.

variations.theory: Exaptation (Cynefin). Procedural Link: Radically repurpose a tool or trait for a function it wasn't evolved for.

Definition: Facilitating the learning and transfer of Exaptation. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Take a feature, tool, or resource that evolved for one specific purpose and adapt it to solve a completely different problem in a new context.

Definition: The universal structural principle of Exaptation. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Take a feature, tool, or resource that evolved for one specific purpose and adapt it to solve a completely different problem in a new context.

concepts.name: Expression
concepts.scenario: Explaining a complex algorithm to investors.
concepts.theory_application: Translate an internal idea or abstract concept into an external, communicable form (visual, verbal, or physical) that others can understand and engage with.

variations.theory: Definition: Koestler defined creativity as 'bisociation'—combining two unrelated matrices of thought. Procedural Link: The hypothesis is expressed in multiple modalities (e.g., equation, diagram, plain language) to ensure clarity and testability.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Multi-Modal Diagram of the algorithm.

variations.theory: Definition: Christensen defines disruptive innovation. Procedural Link: The idea is expressed as a User Story (As a [user], I want [feature], so that [value]) to ensure it is user-centric and actionable.
variations.specific_deliverable: A User Story Card for the investor deck.

variations.theory: Definition: Deconstruction reveals the limits of the language. Procedural Link: The interpretive insight is expressed as a Claim that is both specific and significant.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Value Proposition Claim for the pitch.

variations.theory: Definition: Duchamp re-contextualized ordinary objects as art. Procedural Link: The idea is expressed through rapid, low-fidelity sketching to externalize the concept before it is fully formed.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Visual Metaphor Sketch of the process.

variations.theory: Definition: Ostrom studied self-governing institutions. Procedural Link: The idea is expressed through dialogue and storytelling to ensure it is understood and integrated by the community.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Narrative Script for the presentation.

variations.theory: Definition: Facilitating the learning and transfer of Expression. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Translate an internal idea or abstract concept into an external, communicable form (visual, verbal, or physical) that others can understand and engage with.

Definition: The universal structural principle of Expression. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Translate an internal idea or abstract concept into an external, communicable form (visual, verbal, or physical) that others can understand and engage with.

concepts.name: Generation
concepts.theory_application: Produce a high volume of potential ideas or solutions using structured techniques to overcome creative blocks and explore the full solution space.

variations.theory: Definition: Koestler defined creativity as 'bisociation'—combining two unrelated matrices of thought. Procedural Link: The session prioritizes the quantity of hypotheses generated over the initial quality to maximize the chance of a breakthrough.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Campaign Idea List of 50 concepts.

variations.theory: Definition: Christensen defines disruptive innovation. Procedural Link: The session uses time-boxing and a high quota (e.g., 50 ideas in 15 minutes) to force the team into a divergent, System 1 mindset.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Time-Boxed Idea Sheet from the sprint.

variations.theory: Definition: Deconstruction reveals the limits of the language. Procedural Link: The generated ideas are grounded in collective dialogue with the community, ensuring the solutions are grounded in lived experience.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Community Input Log for slogans.

variations.theory: Definition: Duchamp re-contextualized ordinary objects as art. Procedural Link: The session uses structured constraints (SCAMPER) to systematically generate variations on an existing concept.
variations.specific_deliverable: A SCAMPER Variation List of the logo.

variations.theory: Definition: Ostrom studied self-governing institutions. Procedural Link: The generated solutions target high-leverage points in the system (e.g., changing a rule) rather than low-leverage points (e.g., fixing a symptom).
variations.specific_deliverable: A Circle Output Record of themes.

variations.theory: Definition: Facilitating the learning and transfer of Generation. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Produce a high volume of potential ideas or solutions using structured techniques to overcome creative blocks and explore the full solution space.

Definition: The universal structural principle of Generation. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Produce a high volume of potential ideas or solutions using structured techniques to overcome creative blocks and explore the full solution space.

concepts.name: Guide: Facilitation
concepts.theory_application: Guide a group through a structured process of interaction, ensuring equitable participation, managing conflict, and steering the group toward a shared outcome.

variations.theory: Definition: Koestler defined creativity as 'bisociation'—combining two unrelated matrices of thought. Procedural Link: The facilitator successfully enforces the rule of 'defer judgment' to protect the generation of bold, non-consensus hypotheses.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Rule Enforcement Script for the session.

variations.theory: Definition: Christensen defines disruptive innovation. Procedural Link: The facilitator successfully enforces the timebox and ensures the team moves from divergence to convergence efficiently.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Workshop Agenda with strict timing.

variations.theory: Definition: Deconstruction reveals the limits of the language. Procedural Link: The facilitator successfully 'holds the space' for critical dialogue, protecting students from personal attack when they offer controversial ideas.

Definition: Duchamp re-contextualized ordinary objects as art. Procedural Link: The facilitator successfully asks clarifying questions that help the artist articulate the tacit intent behind their work.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Question Bank for the facilitator.

variations.theory: Definition: Ostrom studied self-governing institutions. Procedural Link: The facilitator successfully models humility and ensures the dialogue is focused on systemic issues, not individual blame.
Definition: Facilitation Styles (Hierarchical, Cooperative, Autonomous). Procedural Link: Match the facilitation style to the group's maturity and the task's complexity.

Definition: The universal structural principle of Guide: Facilitation. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Guide a group through a structured process of interaction, ensuring equitable participation, managing conflict, and steering the group toward a shared outcome.

concepts.name: How Might We
concepts.scenario: Reducing plastic waste in a school cafeteria.
concepts.theory_application: Reframe a problem statement into an open-ended question that invites creative solutions, shifting the mindset from 'this is impossible' to 'what if'.

variations.theory: Definition: HMW questions translate problems into actionable opportunities. Procedural Link: The action is to frame a technical challenge as an open-ended question (e.g., 'HMW build a sensor that is 10x smaller?') to force creative solutions beyond incremental improvements.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Technical HMW Prompt focusing on material properties.
variations.rubric: Frames technical challenge as open question.

variations.theory: Definition: HMW questions are the bridge from the empathy phase to the ideation phase. Procedural Link: The action is to use the HMW format to translate user pain points into actionable opportunities for brainstorming sessions.
variations.specific_deliverable: A User-Centric HMW Card focusing on student behavior.

variations.theory: Definition: hooks advocates for education as the 'practice of freedom.' Procedural Link: The action is to frame a social problem as an HMW question (e.g., 'HMW challenge the dominant narrative?') to shift the focus from critique to generative action.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Systemic HMW Question challenging the disposal narrative.

variations.theory: Definition: Eno's cards introduce random constraints to force creative breakthroughs. Procedural Link: The action is to frame an aesthetic challenge as an HMW question to push creative boundaries (e.g., 'HMW communicate sadness using only primary colors?').
variations.specific_deliverable: An Aesthetic HMW Prompt focusing on visual appeal.

variations.theory: Definition: RRI requires anticipating and mitigating unintended consequences. Procedural Link: The action is to frame an ethical dilemma as an HMW question (e.g., 'HMW ensure both security and full privacy?') to generate novel, ethical solutions.
variations.specific_deliverable: An Ethical HMW Challenge focusing on equity.

variations.theory: Definition: Facilitating the learning and transfer of How Might We. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Reframe a problem statement into an open-ended question that invites creative solutions, shifting the mindset from 'this is impossible' to 'what if'.

Definition: The universal structural principle of How Might We. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Reframe a problem statement into an open-ended question that invites creative solutions, shifting the mindset from 'this is impossible' to 'what if'.

concepts.name: Hypothesis
concepts.scenario: Testing a new drug delivery system.
concepts.theory_application: Formulate a specific, testable prediction about the relationship between variables, ensuring that the statement can be proven false by evidence.

variations.theory: Definition: Popper requires a theory to be falsifiable. Procedural Link: The action is to formulate the hypothesis to be falsifiable; it must be specific enough that an experiment could prove it wrong.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Falsifiable Hypothesis for the clinical trial.

variations.theory: Definition: The hypothesis is the 'leap of faith' statement that guides the MVP test. Procedural Link: The action is to frame the hypothesis as a 'leap of faith' statement: 'We believe that [X feature] will cause [Y outcome] for [Z users].'
variations.specific_deliverable: A Leap of Faith Assumption for the market.

variations.theory: Definition: Toulmin's model requires a Claim to be supported by evidence. Procedural Link: The action is to formulate the hypothesis as a Claim that is both specific and significant, ready to be supported by evidence.

Definition: Arnheim analyzes the psychology of visual perception. Procedural Link: The action is to formulate the hypothesis as a statement of aesthetic intent (e.g., 'The juxtaposition of these colors will evoke a sense of unease').
variations.specific_deliverable: A Design Intent Statement for the packaging.

variations.theory: Definition: The principle requires considering the impact of current actions on seven generations into the future. Procedural Link: The action is to formulate the hypothesis as a prediction of long-term impact (e.g., 'This action will benefit the seventh generation').
variations.specific_deliverable: A Long-Term Impact Prediction for the ecosystem.

variations.theory: Definition: Facilitating the learning and transfer of Hypothesis. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Formulate a specific, testable prediction about the relationship between variables, ensuring that the statement can be proven false by evidence.

Definition: The universal structural principle of Hypothesis. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Formulate a specific, testable prediction about the relationship between variables, ensuring that the statement can be proven false by evidence.

concepts.name: Ideation
concepts.theory_application: Engage in a structured process of generating, developing, and communicating new ideas, prioritizing quantity and variety before selection.

variations.theory: Definition: Osborn defined the rule of 'defer judgment'. Procedural Link: The action is to prioritize the quantity of ideas generated over the initial quality to maximize the chance of a breakthrough.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Volume Log of 100 video concepts.

variations.theory: Definition: Design Thinking uses time-boxing to force divergence. Procedural Link: The action is to use time-boxing and a high quota (e.g., 50 ideas in 15 minutes) to force the team into a divergent, System 1 mindset.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Time-Boxed Idea Sheet from the sprint.

variations.theory: Definition: PAR requires the research question to emerge from the community. Procedural Link: The action is to generate ideas through collective dialogue with the community, ensuring the solutions are grounded in lived experience.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Community Idea Board for the campaign.

variations.theory: Definition: SCAMPER is a checklist for systematic variation. Procedural Link: The action is to use structured constraints (SCAMPER) to systematically generate variations on an existing concept.
variations.specific_deliverable: A SCAMPER List of video styles.

variations.theory: Definition: Ostrom studied self-governing institutions. Procedural Link: The generated solutions target high-leverage points in the system (e.g., changing a rule) rather than low-leverage points (e.g., fixing a symptom).
variations.specific_deliverable: A Circle Input Record ensuring equity.

variations.theory: Definition: Facilitating the learning and transfer of Ideation. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Engage in a structured process of generating, developing, and communicating new ideas, prioritizing quantity and variety before selection.

Definition: The universal structural principle of Ideation. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Engage in a structured process of generating, developing, and communicating new ideas, prioritizing quantity and variety before selection.

concepts.name: Incubation
concepts.theory_application: Deliberately step away from the problem after a period of intense focus, allowing subconscious processes to consolidate information and generate insights.

variations.theory: Definition: The theory states that the hippocampus consolidates memories during rest. Procedural Link: The action is to schedule a deliberate period of rest after intense work to allow memory consolidation of complex new information (offline learning). (N97)
variations.specific_deliverable: A Rest Schedule for offline learning.

variations.theory: Definition: Incubation allows System 1 (intuition) to work on the problem subconsciously. Procedural Link: The action is to schedule a break between the problem definition and the solution generation to allow System 1 (intuition) to work on the problem in the background.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Break Protocol for the research team.

variations.theory: Definition: Wallas defined the four stages of creativity: preparation, incubation, illumination, and verification. Procedural Link: The action is to allow a draft or idea to rest for days or weeks before returning to it with a fresh, critical eye.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Drafting Pause Plan for the paper.

variations.theory: Definition: Incubation precedes the 'illumination'—the sudden, emergent insight. Procedural Link: The action is to intentionally sleep on a problem or engage in a meditative walk to encourage emergent insight.

Definition: Bakhtin's theory emphasizes that meaning is created through dialogue. Procedural Link: The action is to allow the collective dialogue to rest for a period, trusting that the emergent integrated knowledge will surface when the group reconvenes.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Dialogue Pause Agreement for the group.

variations.theory: Definition: Facilitating the learning and transfer of Incubation. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Deliberately step away from the problem after a period of intense focus, allowing subconscious processes to consolidate information and generate insights.

Definition: The universal structural principle of Incubation. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Deliberately step away from the problem after a period of intense focus, allowing subconscious processes to consolidate information and generate insights.

concepts.name: Intuition
concepts.theory_application: Recognize and record immediate, non-conscious judgments or 'gut feelings' as valid data points that reflect deep pattern recognition, then subject them to verification.

variations.theory: Definition: Klein's theory defines intuition as non-conscious pattern-matching. Procedural Link: The action is to treat the expert's 'gut feeling' as a valid data point derived from non-conscious pattern-matching, but subject it to rigorous testing.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Gut Check Record of the decision.

variations.theory: Definition: Intuition is a System 1 function (fast, intuitive). Procedural Link: The action is to use System 1 intuition to generate the initial idea, but immediately switch to System 2 analysis to verify its feasibility and value.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Dual-Process Log of the analysis.

variations.theory: Definition: Damasio's theory defines the 'somatic marker' (the body's emotional signal) guiding decision-making. Procedural Link: The action is to treat the 'somatic marker' (the felt sense of rightness) as a signal of deep, non-conscious pattern recognition that guides the interpretive choice.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Somatic Signal Log of physical reactions.

variations.theory: Definition: Arnheim analyzes the psychology of visual perception. Procedural Link: The action is to trust the 'felt sense' of aesthetic rightness, but immediately articulate the underlying principle to transform intuition into a reusable design rule.

Definition: Damasio's theory defines the 'somatic marker' (the body's emotional signal) guiding decision-making. Procedural Link: The action is to treat the 'gut feeling' of ethical discomfort as a critical signal that demands immediate, slow, and deliberate moral analysis.
variations.specific_deliverable: An Ethical Alarm Log of discomfort.

variations.theory: Definition: Facilitating the learning and transfer of Intuition. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Recognize and record immediate, non-conscious judgments or 'gut feelings' as valid data points that reflect deep pattern recognition, then subject them to verification.

Definition: The universal structural principle of Intuition. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Recognize and record immediate, non-conscious judgments or 'gut feelings' as valid data points that reflect deep pattern recognition, then subject them to verification.

concepts.name: Invention
concepts.theory_application: Create a novel device, method, or process by combining existing elements in a new way or applying a principle from one domain to another.

variations.theory: Definition: Koestler defined creativity as 'bisociation'—combining two unrelated matrices of thought. Procedural Link: The action is to focus on 'bisociation'—the combination of two previously unrelated matrices of thought (e.g., biology and engineering) to generate a novel solution.

Definition: Christensen defines disruptive innovation. Procedural Link: The action is to focus on 'disruptive innovation'—creating a solution that is initially inferior but cheaper/simpler, opening up a new market.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Disruptive Concept for low-cost markets.

variations.theory: Definition: Deconstruction reveals the limits of the language. Procedural Link: The action is to focus on 'reconstruction'—creating a new theoretical framework that is not dependent on the flawed binary oppositions of the old system.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Reconstructed Framework for water rights.

variations.theory: Definition: Duchamp re-contextualized ordinary objects as art. Procedural Link: The action is to focus on 're-contextualization'—taking an existing object and re-contextualizing it as art, exapting its functional form for aesthetic meaning.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Readymade Prototype using found objects.

variations.theory: Definition: Ostrom studied self-governing institutions. Procedural Link: The action is to focus on 'polycentric governance'—inventing a new system of nested, self-governing institutions to manage shared resources.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Polycentric Governance Plan for the water.

variations.theory: Definition: Facilitating the learning and transfer of Invention. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Create a novel device, method, or process by combining existing elements in a new way or applying a principle from one domain to another.

Definition: The universal structural principle of Invention. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Create a novel device, method, or process by combining existing elements in a new way or applying a principle from one domain to another.

concepts.name: Play
concepts.theory_application: Engage in unstructured, non-goal-oriented activity to lower inhibitions, explore possibilities, and discover unexpected connections.

variations.theory: Definition: Feynman advocated for 'serious play' in scientific discovery. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in 'serious play' with the experimental apparatus or data to discover unexpected effects that formal methods might miss.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Play Experiment Log of physics toys.

variations.theory: Definition: Design Thinking uses playful, low-stakes activities to encourage participation. Procedural Link: The action is to use playful, non-judgmental ideation techniques to lower inhibitions and foster creativity.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Play Workshop Guide for the team.

variations.theory: Definition: hooks advocates for education as the 'practice of freedom.' Procedural Link: The action is to use playful dialogue and humor to challenge rigid intellectual hierarchies and create a safe space for critical thought.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Playful Dialogue Script for the classroom.

variations.theory: Definition: Cage introduced chance operations to composition. Procedural Link: The action is to engage with materials without a fixed plan, prioritizing enjoyment and discovery over perfection.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Material Play Session with clay.

variations.theory: Definition: The Circle Way uses shared, low-stakes activities to build social capital. Procedural Link: The action is to use shared, low-stakes communal activity to build the social capital necessary for high-stakes dialogue.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Community Game Plan for bonding.

variations.theory: Definition: Facilitating the learning and transfer of Play. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Engage in unstructured, non-goal-oriented activity to lower inhibitions, explore possibilities, and discover unexpected connections.

Definition: The universal structural principle of Play. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Engage in unstructured, non-goal-oriented activity to lower inhibitions, explore possibilities, and discover unexpected connections.

concepts.name: Possibility
concepts.theory_application: Generate a range of potential future states or solutions, moving beyond the probable to explore the plausible and the possible.

variations.theory: Definition: Popper requires a theory to be falsifiable. Procedural Link: The action is to generate a portfolio of falsifiable possibilities—hypotheses that are worthy of being proven wrong.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Scenario Portfolio of climate models.

variations.theory: Definition: Design Thinking uses divergence to maximize options. Procedural Link: The action is to generate a portfolio of viable solutions that address the user's needs and the market opportunity.
Definition: Deconstruction reveals the limits of the language. Procedural Link: The action is to generate a portfolio of competing interpretations that reveal the full complexity of the text.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Narrative Futures Deck of social change.

variations.theory: Definition: Arnheim analyzes the psychology of visual perception. Procedural Link: The action is to generate a portfolio of aesthetic solutions that explore the full range of formal possibilities.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Visual Futures Gallery of landscapes.

variations.theory: Definition: The principle requires considering the impact of current actions on seven generations into the future. Procedural Link: The action is to generate a portfolio of sustainable futures that honor the needs of the next seven generations.

Definition: Facilitating the learning and transfer of Possibility. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Generate a range of potential future states or solutions, moving beyond the probable to explore the plausible and the possible.

Definition: The universal structural principle of Possibility. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Generate a range of potential future states or solutions, moving beyond the probable to explore the plausible and the possible.

concepts.name: Environment of Open Communication
concepts.scenario: Forming a new high-stakes project team.
concepts.theory_application: Create an environment where team members feel safe to take risks, share ideas, and admit mistakes without fear of negative consequences.

variations.theory: Definition: Edmondson defines psychological safety as the belief that interpersonal risk-taking is safe. Procedural Link: The action is for the leader to explicitly state that 'failure is data' and that bold, non-consensus hypotheses are encouraged.

Definition: Psychological safety is the belief that interpersonal risk-taking is safe. Procedural Link: The action is for the leader to actively intervene to stop blame and frame all errors as systemic learning opportunities.

Definition: Palmer advocates for creating a 'circle of trust' in the classroom. Procedural Link: The action is for the facilitator to 'hold the space' for critical dialogue, protecting students from personal attack when they offer controversial ideas.

Definition: The CRP gives the artist agency over the critique process. Procedural Link: The action is for the facilitator to enforce a protocol where the artist speaks first and last, giving them agency over the critique process.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Critique Protocol for the studio.

variations.theory: Definition: Restorative Justice focuses on repairing harm by addressing the needs of the victim. Procedural Link: The action is for the facilitator to ensure the dialogue is 'blameless' and focused on the harm and needs, not on individual punishment.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Restorative Circle Guide for conflict.

variations.theory: Definition: Facilitating the learning and transfer of Environment of Open Communication. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Create an environment where team members feel safe to take risks, share ideas, and admit mistakes without fear of negative consequences.

Definition: The universal structural principle of Environment of Open Communication. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Create an environment where team members feel safe to take risks, share ideas, and admit mistakes without fear of negative consequences.

concepts.name: Rival Readings
concepts.theory_application: Deliberately generate and explore multiple, conflicting interpretations of the same data or text to avoid confirmation bias and uncover deeper truths.

variations.theory: Definition: Chamberlin advocated for pursuing multiple hypotheses simultaneously. Procedural Link: The action is to generate multiple, mutually exclusive hypotheses and pursue them all simultaneously to avoid confirmation bias.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Multiple Hypothesis Matrix for the data.

variations.theory: Definition: The Lean Startup uses A/B testing to test rival assumptions. Procedural Link: The action is to generate competing MVPs to test rival assumptions about user behavior, letting the market decide the winner.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Split-Test Plan for two features.

variations.theory: Definition: Toulmin's model requires a Claim to be supported by evidence. Procedural Link: The action is to generate competing interpretations for a single text, ensuring the final thesis is robust against challenge.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Rival Interpretation Paper of the text.

variations.theory: Definition: The CRP gives the artist agency over the critique process. Procedural Link: The action is to ask the audience to generate multiple, competing interpretations of the work's meaning before the artist speaks.
variations.specific_deliverable: An Audience Feedback Log of meanings.

variations.theory: Definition: Berlin defined tension as the conflict between core values that cannot be fully reconciled. Procedural Link: The action is to articulate the dilemma by presenting the strongest case for both conflicting values (e.g., security and freedom) before seeking a resolution.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Value Conflict Memo outlining the dilemma.

variations.theory: Definition: Facilitating the learning and transfer of Rival Readings. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Deliberately generate and explore multiple, conflicting interpretations of the same data or text to avoid confirmation bias and uncover deeper truths.

Definition: The universal structural principle of Rival Readings. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Deliberately generate and explore multiple, conflicting interpretations of the same data or text to avoid confirmation bias and uncover deeper truths.

concepts.name: SCAMPER
concepts.theory_application: Use the SCAMPER checklist (Substitute, Combine, Adapt, Modify, Put to another use, Eliminate, Reverse) to systematically generate new ideas or variations.

variations.theory: Definition: SCAMPER is a checklist for systematic variation. Procedural Link: The action is to use the prompts (Substitute, Combine, Adapt, etc.) to systematically generate new experimental designs or technical solutions.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Design Variation List for the prototype.

variations.theory: Definition: SCAMPER is a checklist for systematic variation. Procedural Link: The action is to use the prompts to systematically innovate on an existing product feature or business model.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Feature Innovation Deck using SCAMPER.

variations.theory: Definition: SCAMPER is a checklist for systematic variation. Procedural Link: The action is to use the prompts to systematically transform an existing theoretical argument into a new, original hypothesis.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Theory Revision Map using prompts.

variations.theory: Definition: SCAMPER is a checklist for systematic variation. Procedural Link: The action is to use the prompts to systematically vary an aesthetic design concept and force creative breakthroughs.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Visual Variation Series of the logo.

variations.theory: Definition: SCAMPER is a checklist for systematic variation. Procedural Link: The action is to apply SCAMPER to existing governance protocols or rituals to transform them into more effective forms.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Protocol Update Proposal using SCAMPER.

variations.theory: Definition: Facilitating the learning and transfer of SCAMPER. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Use the SCAMPER checklist (Substitute, Combine, Adapt, Modify, Put to another use, Eliminate, Reverse) to systematically generate new ideas or variations.

Definition: The universal structural principle of SCAMPER. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Use the SCAMPER checklist (Substitute, Combine, Adapt, Modify, Put to another use, Eliminate, Reverse) to systematically generate new ideas or variations.

concepts.name: Sketching
concepts.theory_application: Use rapid, low-fidelity visual representations to externalize thoughts, explore possibilities, and identify logical or aesthetic flaws before committing to a final design.

variations.theory: Definition: Sketching is a tool for thinking and externalizing logic. Procedural Link: The action is to sketch the experimental apparatus or the data flow diagram to externalize the problem and find flaws in the logic.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Logic Flow Sketch of the algorithm.

variations.theory: Definition: Design Thinking uses low-fidelity sketching to externalize UI ideas. Procedural Link: The action is to use rapid, low-fidelity sketching (e.g., Crazy Eights) to externalize UI ideas and reduce the fear of failure.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Crazy Eights Sheet of UI concepts.

variations.theory: Definition: Toulmin's model requires a Claim to be supported by evidence. Procedural Link: The action is to sketch the Argument Map (N22) to visually structure the claims, evidence, and warrants of the thesis.
variations.specific_deliverable: An Argument Map Sketch of the essay.

variations.theory: Definition: Da Vinci's notebooks integrated art and science through observation. Procedural Link: The action is to use sketching as a tool for thinking, capturing the visual form while simultaneously documenting the underlying mechanical or emotional principles.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Form Study Sketch of the icon.

variations.theory: Definition: Meadows focuses on identifying feedback loops. Procedural Link: The action is to sketch the system diagram to visualize the feedback loops and leverage points of the social problem.
variations.specific_deliverable: A System Loop Sketch of user interaction.

variations.theory: Definition: Facilitating the learning and transfer of Sketching. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Use rapid, low-fidelity visual representations to externalize thoughts, explore possibilities, and identify logical or aesthetic flaws before committing to a final design.

Definition: The universal structural principle of Sketching. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Use rapid, low-fidelity visual representations to externalize thoughts, explore possibilities, and identify logical or aesthetic flaws before committing to a final design.

concepts.name: Steelmanning
concepts.theory_application: Articulate the strongest possible version of the opposing argument or hypothesis to ensure that your own position is robust and not based on attacking a 'straw man'.

variations.theory: Definition: Chamberlin advocated for pursuing multiple hypotheses simultaneously. Procedural Link: The action is to formulate the strongest possible version of a competing scientific hypothesis before attempting to falsify it.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Rival Hypothesis Brief for the debate.

variations.theory: Definition: Munger advocates for inversion—thinking backward. Procedural Link: The action is to construct the strongest possible case for a competitor’s product or business model to identify real vulnerabilities in our own proposal.

Definition: Kahneman defines confirmation bias. Procedural Link: The action is to articulate the most compelling version of an opposing interpretive stance to strengthen one's own argument and overcome confirmation bias.

Definition: The CRP gives the artist agency over the critique process. Procedural Link: The action is to articulate the strongest argument in favor of a discarded aesthetic choice to understand its power before rejecting it.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Defense of the Rejected concept.

variations.theory: Definition: Berlin defined tension as the conflict between core values that cannot be fully reconciled. Procedural Link: The action is to articulate the dilemma by presenting the strongest case for both conflicting values (e.g., security and freedom) before seeking a resolution.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Value Conflict Analysis of the policy.

variations.theory: Definition: Facilitating the learning and transfer of Steelmanning. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Articulate the strongest possible version of the opposing argument or hypothesis to ensure that your own position is robust and not based on attacking a 'straw man'.

Definition: The universal structural principle of Steelmanning. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Articulate the strongest possible version of the opposing argument or hypothesis to ensure that your own position is robust and not based on attacking a 'straw man'.

concepts.name: User Story
concepts.scenario: Defining features for a new health app.
concepts.theory_application: Frame a requirement or feature request as a short, simple description from the perspective of the person who desires the new capability, focusing on the value it provides.

variations.theory: Definition: Scrum uses User Stories as the core unit of work. Procedural Link: The action is to translate a hypothesis into a feature request framed from a user's perspective (ee.g., 'As a scientist, I want a faster plotting tool, so I can analyze my data quickly').
variations.specific_deliverable: A Feature Request Card for data tracking.

variations.theory: Definition: User Stories are informal explanations of features from the user’s perspective. Procedural Link: The action is to ensure the core unit of work is an informal explanation of a product feature from the end user’s perspective.
variations.specific_deliverable: A User Story: 'As a patient, I want...'
variations.rubric: Ensure core unit is informal explanation.

variations.theory: Definition: hooks advocates for education as the 'practice of freedom.' Procedural Link: The action is to translate a philosophical inquiry into a narrative centered on the lived experience and needs of a specific demographic group.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Lived Experience Narrative of illness.

variations.theory: Definition: Norman focuses on affordances and user understanding. Procedural Link: The action is to frame the creative experience in terms of the audience's emotional journey (e.g., 'As a viewer, I want to feel a sense of loss, so I can reflect on my own mortality').
variations.specific_deliverable: An Emotional Journey Map for the user.

variations.theory: Definition: Restorative Justice focuses on repairing harm by addressing the needs of the victim. Procedural Link: The action is to frame a social issue in terms of the lived experience and needs of a community member.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Community Needs Story for the app.
variations.rubric: Frame social issue as lived experience.

variations.theory: Definition: Facilitating the learning and transfer of User Story. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Frame a requirement or feature request as a short, simple description from the perspective of the person who desires the new capability, focusing on the value it provides.

Definition: The universal structural principle of User Story. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Frame a requirement or feature request as a short, simple description from the perspective of the person who desires the new capability, focusing on the value it provides.

concepts.name: Psychological Safety
concepts.theory_application: Create a condition where team members feel safe to take interpersonal risks, such as sharing half-baked ideas or admitting ignorance.

variations.theory: Definition: Psychological Safety is the belief that the team is safe for risk-taking. Procedural Link: The action is to explicitly frame the work as a learning problem, not an execution problem, to lower the cost of error.
Definition: Safety is the #1 predictor of team performance. Procedural Link: The action is to institute 'conversational turn-taking' rules to ensure no single voice dominates.
Definition: The Circle of Trust protects the soul. Procedural Link: The action is to enforce the rule of 'no fixing, no saving, no advising' during the generative phase.
Definition: Status transactions block creativity. Procedural Link: The action is to play status-lowering games to flatten the hierarchy before ideation.
Definition: The classroom must be a place of liberation. Procedural Link: The action is to validate the subjective experience of every participant as authoritative data.

Definition: Facilitating the learning and transfer of Psychological Safety. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Create a condition where team members feel safe to take interpersonal risks, such as sharing half-baked ideas or admitting ignorance.

Definition: The universal structural principle of Psychological Safety. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Create a condition where team members feel safe to take interpersonal risks, such as sharing half-baked ideas or admitting ignorance.

concepts.name: Combinatorial Play
concepts.theory_application: Generate novelty not by invention, but by the systematic combination of existing, unrelated concepts.

variations.theory: Definition: Bisociation is the connection of two previously unrelated matrices of thought. Procedural Link: The action is to force a connection between the current problem and a random biological system.
Definition: Creativity is just connecting things. Procedural Link: The action is to combine a business model from one industry with a technology from another (e.g., 'Tinder for Dogs').
variations.rubric: Combines model and tech from different fields.

variations.theory: Definition: The Montage constructs meaning from fragments. Procedural Link: The action is to place two unrelated historical texts side-by-side and read the space between them.
variations.rubric: Reads the space between unrelated texts.

variations.theory: Definition: Scenius is collective genius. Procedural Link: The action is to sample and remix an existing work, altering its context to create new meaning.
Definition: Hybridity is the emergence of new cultural forms at the border. Procedural Link: The action is to identify the 'Third Space' created by the collision of two cultural practices.
Bisociation. Procedural Link: Force the intersection of two unrelated matrices of thought to generate novelty.

Definition: Facilitating the learning and transfer of Combinatorial Play. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Generate novelty not by invention, but by the systematic combination of existing, unrelated concepts.

Definition: The universal structural principle of Combinatorial Play. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Generate novelty not by invention, but by the systematic combination of existing, unrelated concepts.

concepts.name: Enabling Constraints
concepts.scenario: A team paralyzed by infinite possibilities.
concepts.theory_application: Introduce artificial boundaries that limit the solution space, forcing creativity and preventing paralysis.

variations.theory: Definition: Enabling constraints govern the system without micromanaging it. Procedural Link: The action is to define the 'boundary conditions' (e.g., temperature range) but leave the interaction rules open.
Definition: Creativity loves constraints. Procedural Link: The action is to artificially limit the resources (e.g., 'build this for $100') to force a non-linear solution.

Definition: Potential Literature is created through formal constraints. Procedural Link: The action is to apply a formal rule (e.g., 'write without the letter E') to force the brain out of habitual language patterns.
variations.rubric: Applies formal rule to break habit.

variations.theory: Definition: The Dogme 95 manifesto imposes a 'Vow of Chastity'. Procedural Link: The action is to strip away all technical crutches (lighting, filters) to force focus on the core story.
Definition: Rules of the Commons. Procedural Link: The action is to define the 'access rules' that constrain individual greed to enable collective flourishing.

Definition: Facilitating the learning and transfer of Enabling Constraints. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Introduce artificial boundaries that limit the solution space, forcing creativity and preventing paralysis.

Definition: The universal structural principle of Enabling Constraints. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Introduce artificial boundaries that limit the solution space, forcing creativity and preventing paralysis.

concepts.name: Napkin Pitch

variations.theory: Visual thinking clarifies complexity. Procedural Link: Draw the 'Big Picture' of the solution using simple shapes and arrows.

Definition: Facilitating the learning and transfer of Napkin Pitch. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Distill a complex concept into a simple visual and verbal explanation that fits on a napkin.

Definition: Applying rigorous observation and testing to Napkin Pitch. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Distill a complex concept into a simple visual and verbal explanation that fits on a napkin.
Definition: The universal structural principle of Napkin Pitch. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Distill a complex concept into a simple visual and verbal explanation that fits on a napkin.
Definition: Ensuring the relational integrity of Napkin Pitch. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Distill a complex concept into a simple visual and verbal explanation that fits on a napkin.
Definition: Optimizing the flow of value regarding Napkin Pitch. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Distill a complex concept into a simple visual and verbal explanation that fits on a napkin.

Definition: Analyzing the historical and social context of Napkin Pitch. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Distill a complex concept into a simple visual and verbal explanation that fits on a napkin.

concepts.scenario: Explaining a startup idea in a bar.
concepts.theory_application: Distill a complex concept into a simple visual and verbal explanation that fits on a napkin.

concepts.name: Radiant Thinking

variations.theory: Definition: The brain works associatively, not linearly. Procedural Link: Use images and colors in a radial structure to trigger 'whole brain' thinking.

Definition: Facilitating the learning and transfer of Radiant Thinking. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Mimic the brain's associative structure by generating ideas radially from a central node, rather than in linear lists.

Definition: Applying rigorous observation and testing to Radiant Thinking. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Mimic the brain's associative structure by generating ideas radially from a central node, rather than in linear lists.

Definition: The universal structural principle of Radiant Thinking. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Mimic the brain's associative structure by generating ideas radially from a central node, rather than in linear lists.

Definition: Ensuring the relational integrity of Radiant Thinking. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Mimic the brain's associative structure by generating ideas radially from a central node, rather than in linear lists.

Definition: Optimizing the flow of value regarding Radiant Thinking. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Mimic the brain's associative structure by generating ideas radially from a central node, rather than in linear lists.

Definition: Analyzing the historical and social context of Radiant Thinking. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Mimic the brain's associative structure by generating ideas radially from a central node, rather than in linear lists.

concepts.scenario: Brainstorming uses for a new technology.
concepts.theory_application: Mimic the brain's associative structure by generating ideas radially from a central node, rather than in linear lists.

concepts.name: Integrative Thinking

variations.theory: Definition: Design thinking is the ability to exploit opposing ideas. Procedural Link: Identify the core tension and design a solution that resolves it (AND, not OR).

Definition: Facilitating the learning and transfer of Integrative Thinking. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Hold two opposing ideas in tension to create a new model that contains the superior aspects of both, rather than compromising.

Definition: Applying rigorous observation and testing to Integrative Thinking. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Hold two opposing ideas in tension to create a new model that contains the superior aspects of both, rather than compromising.

Definition: The universal structural principle of Integrative Thinking. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Hold two opposing ideas in tension to create a new model that contains the superior aspects of both, rather than compromising.

Definition: Ensuring the relational integrity of Integrative Thinking. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Hold two opposing ideas in tension to create a new model that contains the superior aspects of both, rather than compromising.

Definition: Analyzing the historical and social context of Integrative Thinking. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Hold two opposing ideas in tension to create a new model that contains the superior aspects of both, rather than compromising.

Definition: Exploring the expressive potential of Integrative Thinking. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Hold two opposing ideas in tension to create a new model that contains the superior aspects of both, rather than compromising.

concepts.scenario: Resolving the tension between luxury and affordability.
concepts.theory_application: Hold two opposing ideas in tension to create a new model that contains the superior aspects of both, rather than compromising.

concepts.name: Associative Thinking

variations.theory: The brain works radially, not linearly.
Definition: Facilitating the learning and transfer of Associative Thinking. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Connect unconnected ideas using non-linear logic.
Definition: The universal structural principle of Associative Thinking. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Connect unconnected ideas using non-linear logic.
Definition: Ensuring the relational integrity of Associative Thinking. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Connect unconnected ideas using non-linear logic.
Definition: Optimizing the flow of value regarding Associative Thinking. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Connect unconnected ideas using non-linear logic.
Definition: Analyzing the historical and social context of Associative Thinking. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Connect unconnected ideas using non-linear logic.
Definition: Exploring the expressive potential of Associative Thinking. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Connect unconnected ideas using non-linear logic.

concepts.scenario: Using a random word to solve a logistics problem.
concepts.theory_application: Connect unconnected ideas using non-linear logic.

concepts.name: Emotional Drivers

variations.theory: Social connection drives health behavior.
Definition: Facilitating the learning and transfer of Emotional Drivers. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Identify the core feeling that motivates behavior.
Definition: Applying rigorous observation and testing to Emotional Drivers. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Identify the core feeling that motivates behavior.
Definition: The universal structural principle of Emotional Drivers. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Identify the core feeling that motivates behavior.
Definition: Ensuring the relational integrity of Emotional Drivers. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Identify the core feeling that motivates behavior.
Definition: Analyzing the historical and social context of Emotional Drivers. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Identify the core feeling that motivates behavior.
Definition: Exploring the expressive potential of Emotional Drivers. Procedural Link: Apply this concept to: Identify the core feeling that motivates behavior.

concepts.scenario: Why do people actually buy health apps?
concepts.theory_application: Identify the core feeling that motivates behavior.
